content:
Yes, Catholic University of America is constantly expanding its academic programs and research areas to better meet the needs of its students and contribute to society's needs. The university has, in recent years, added new academic programs and research centers across various subjects.

Some of the newly added academic programs at the university include a Bachelor of Science in Nursing, the Master of Science in Data Science, and the Master's in Theological Studies with a specialization in Hispanic ministry. The university has also added new degree programs in business, engineering, and architecture.

In terms of research, the university has established several research centers over the past few years, including the Center for the Study of Statesmanship, the Institute for Human Ecology, and the Center for Cultural Engagement. These centers focus on various research areas, such as governance, human ecology, and cultural engagement.

The university also encourages interdisciplinary research and collaboration to address complex social problems. For instance, the university has established the cross-disciplinary Foundations of American Democracy initiative to examine American democracy and civic engagement, bringing scholars from different fields together to contribute their expertise.

In summary, the Catholic University of America has been expanding its academic programs and research areas, and it will likely continue to do so to meet the changing demands of society and provide students with an outstanding education that equips them to excel in their chosen fields.
